Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: Is there any way to make a JSP print carriage returns (CR)?: :I'm currently generating some vCards using JSP. I found out some platforms don't recognize these generated vCards unless their lines are separated by Carriage Returns (CR), and JSP seems to use just Line Feed (LF) by default to separate lines.Do you guys know any way to tell the JSP to include a CR between each line?I hope someone has a clue, cause I haven't found much out there...Thanks in advance!
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.

Question: Is there any way to make a JSP print carriage returns (CR)?: :I'm currently generating some vCards using JSP. I found out some platforms don't recognize these generated vCards unless their lines are separated by Carriage Returns (CR), and JSP seems to use just Line Feed (LF) by default to separate lines.Do you guys know any way to tell the JSP to include a CR between each line?I hope someone has a clue, cause I haven't found much out there...Thanks in advance!
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
Answer:<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: PrintWriter out = response.getWriter();
out.write("Line 1\r\n");
out.write("Line 2\r\n");
<<<explanation>>>: The write() method of the PrintWriter class writes a single character. This is a void method.
Question: How to get the current date and time in Java?
Please using this api: Calendar.getInstance.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Calendar.getInstance
<<<code>>>: Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();
Date currentDate = cal.getTime();
<<<explanation>>>: The getTime() method of the Calendar class returns a Date object representing this calendar's time value. This is a Date method.
Question: How to get the current date and time in Java?
Please using this api: LocalDateTime.now.
Answer:<<<api>>>: LocalDateTime.now
<<<code>>>: LocalDateTime currentDateTime = LocalDateTime.now();
<<<explanation>>>: The now() method of the LocalDateTime class returns the current date-time using the system clock and default time-zone. This is a static method.
Question: How to get the current date and time in Java?
Please using this api: Instant.now.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Instant.now
<<<code>>>: Instant currentTime = Instant.now();

Question: How to get the current date and time in Java?
Please using this api: System.currentTimeMillis.
Answer:<<<api>>>: System.currentTimeMillis
<<<code>>>: long currentTimeMillis = System.currentTimeMillis();
<<<explanation>>>: The currentTimeMillis() method of the System class returns the current time in milliseconds. This is a static method.
Question: How to get the current date and time in Java?
Please using this api: System.nanoTime.
Answer:<<<api>>>: System.nanoTime
<<<code>>>: long nanoTime = System.nanoTime();
<<<explanation>>>: The nanoTime() method of the System class returns the current value of the most precise available system timer, in nanoseconds. This is a static method.
